Package controller

Class WordleController

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
controller.WordleController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer
public class WordleController extends Observable implements Observer

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    WordleController(int letters, int maxRows, String filename)
    This creates a controller for a game of wordle The controller can make guesses to the model, and return useful information from the model.

  • Constructor Details

    • WordleController

      public WordleController(int letters, int maxRows, String filename)
      This creates a controller for a game of wordle The controller can make guesses to the model, and return useful information from the model.
      Parameters:
      letters - the number of letters in a guess
      maxRows - the number of guesses allowed, or rows in the game
      filename - the file for the dictionary of all valid words

  • Method Details

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Returns if the game is finished or not. The game is over if it has been the max number of guesses, or the user guessed the word correctly
      Returns:
      true if game is over, false otherwise

    • makeGuess

      public void makeGuess(String guess) throws IncorrectGuessException
      This attempts to make a guess to the model We first validate the guess, and if it is valid then we make the guess in the model, and update our current progress with the data model returns.
      Parameters:
      guess - the string being guessed
      Throws:
      IncorrectGuessException - if the guess was invalid (too long, not a word, or not in the dictionary)

    • getAnswer

      public String getAnswer()
      Gets the answer from the model
      Returns:
      the correct answer for this wordle game

    • getProgress

      public Guess[] getProgress()
      Gets the progress of the game so far. This is used to display
      Returns:
      a list of guesses which represents the progress

    • getGuessedCharacters

      public INDEX_RESULT[] getGuessedCharacters()
      This gets the list of all characters It color codes characters according to if they have not been guessed, are correct, are incorrect, or are correct in the wrong position
      Returns:
      the guessed characters in alphabetical order

    • update

      public void update(Observable o, Object arg)
      This update will come from the observer
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer
      Parameters:
      o - - the model
      arg - - this is the last guess that was generated by the model
